reviews.review_msg: I personally liked her, she was nice to me, I definitely felt comfortable around her. She never yelled at anyone as far as I know, if she caught students doing something crazy, yea she would call them out, but never in a disrespectful way. She is serious but she has to be Otherwise students will walk all over her She has no tolerance for immaturity

There are always two ways to get your message across and she always chooses the wrong way. VERY condescending and needs to learn to show some respect for even the "non-genius" students; heaven forbid if you make a mistake! Basically I'm paying to be in the class so she can get a high off offending me. If I didn't like Chem before, I hate it now..

Rarely in the lab.  I'm sure he knows his stuff, but difficult to approach.  Got an A+ in the class, by when I asked lab questions during his office hours, he pretty much blew me off.  I had a good TA and that made the difference.

If you do something wrong, he assumes you weren't listening during his lab lecture, even though he changes a lot of the steps from the print-out! Some instructor, he's never in the lab. He comes around routinely once or twice and asks everyone "Are you okay"? Other than that, he is never to be found in the lab... found that a little disappointing
Found him extremely condescending. Didn't feel like asking questions, because it wasn't worth the tone of voice.

saw this guy rip a girls lab because she made a VERY small mistake on her lab report (to which she ask the TA prior and the TA told her she understood the mistake and looked past it since they mark it) and yelled at the whole class that “we are not in grade 5”. I can understand a strict prof, but that was extremely unprofessional of him to do
This instructor cares about our safety and learning. However, he is very honest, strict, and deducts a massive chunk of technique marks if things go wrong depending on the situation.

He's an amazing instructor. Easy to follow, clear on expectations, and funny. It's an easy A for the lab unless your a very bad chemist. He can be intimidating at times but when you talk to him , he's very sweet and down to earth.

Overall a pretty nice professor; I have not experienced any 'tantrum issues' with him as other students have stated. His lab briefings are extremely clear and concise: anything important or likely to affect the outcome of the lab will be pointed out. Try to read labs beforehand to have a better idea of what is required and everything will be ok!
